intro: Grangea domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican grangea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands, particularly the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Grangea domingensis is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas within forests or along streambanks.
